Package jester

Class JesterWindow

java.lang.Object
jester.JesterWindow
public class JesterWindow extends Object
JesterWindow provides an abstraction over the main JFrame window used by the Jester framework. It allows easy manipulation of window state, size, position, and appearance.

  • Field Summary

    Field

    frame

      Sets the internal JFrame reference used by the window.

    • maximize

      public void maximize()
      Maximizes the window to fullscreen (windowed mode).

    • minimize

      public void minimize()
      Minimizes the window to the taskbar.

      public void close()
      Closes the window by dispatching a close event.

    • getDimensions

      public Dimension getDimensions()
      Returns the current size of the window.
      Returns:
      A Dimension object representing the width and height.

    • getDesktopDimensions

      public Dimension getDesktopDimensions()
      Returns the size of the user's desktop screen.
      Returns:
      A Dimension object representing the desktop width and height.

    • getFullscreen

      public boolean getFullscreen()
      Checks if the window is currently in fullscreen mode.
      Returns:
      true if fullscreen, false otherwise.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the current width of the window.
      Returns:
      Width in pixels.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns the current height of the window.
      Returns:
      Height in pixels.

    • getIcon

      public Image getIcon()
      Returns the icon currently set on the window.
      Returns:
      An Image object, or null if none is set.

    • getPosition

      public Point getPosition()
      Returns the current screen position of the window.
      Returns:
      A Point object representing the x and y screen position.

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns the current title of the window.
      Returns:
      The window title.

    • isMinimized

      public boolean isMinimized()
      Checks if the window is minimized.
      Returns:
      true if minimized, false otherwise.

    • isMaximized

      public boolean isMaximized()
      Checks if the window is maximized.
      Returns:
      true if maximized, false otherwise.

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      Checks if the window is currently visible.
      Returns:
      true if visible, false otherwise.

    • isResizable

      public boolean isResizable()
      Checks if the window is resizable by the user.
      Returns:
      true if resizable, false otherwise.

    • setResizable

      public void setResizable(boolean resizable)
      Sets whether the window can be resized by the user.
      Parameters:
      resizable - true to allow resizing, false to lock size.

    • restore

      public void restore()
      Restores the window to normal state (not minimized or maximized).

    • setFullscreen

      public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
      Enables or disables fullscreen mode (borderless maximized window).
      Parameters:
      fullscreen - true to enable, false to disable.

    • toggleFullscreen

      public void toggleFullscreen()
      Toggles fullscreen mode on or off.

    • setIcon

      public void setIcon(Image icon)
      Sets the icon displayed in the window title bar.
      Parameters:
      icon - The Image to use as the icon.

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(String title)
      Sets the window title.
      Parameters:
      title - A string representing the window title.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int x, int y)
      Sets the screen position of the window.
      Parameters:
      x - X position in pixels.
      y - Y position in pixels.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the window's dimensions (width and height).
      Parameters:
      width - The desired width in pixels.
      height - The desired height in pixels.

    • centerOnScreen

      public void centerOnScreen()
      Moves the window to the center of the screen.

      Displays a message box with a title and message.

      message - The message content.
